column9: This medicine was administered until school age and preschool began. Daycare providers and myself could deal with the side affects since the medication provided relief. Once school started, her aggressive behavior and hyper attitude increased. The school worked w/me since I am a single Mother. Although, immediately following her treatments it was total chaos. It was a nightmare! Being called to the school to deal w/her after her treatments were given. My insurance didn't cover any other preventive meds due to cost and I had to wait to enroll into a new health plan. What a nightmare! Asthma medications are very costly and out-of-pocket expenses are extremely high. Switching to a more expensive medication completely changed her attitude for the better. I've never dealt w/asthma until my daughter and was not aware of all the affects. I've learned over the years and will never give or recommend albuterol for young children. The medicine made her heart beat so fast that it scared me. She could never completely settle down after her treatments. In the end, happiness was finally obtained.

column9: I've had bronchitis-like symptoms for about a year.  I'm on symbicort twice daily and have albuterol for in between use. column9: I have had asthma since I was 19 yrs old. Being so close to Mexico allowed me to get my inhalers cheaper and quicker. Now with the passport change and all the recent violence in Mexico, I've had to switch to an American brand and it doesn't work as well. Plus, the solution in the old inhaler felt heavier so I knew when I was running low, now I can't tell. The American version also has tons of side effects that I never felt with my old inhaler. For the past 2 months I've been dizzy, had nausea, have trouble sleeping, trouble eating, and moody. I really don't like my new inhaler, but my choices are to use the new one with a ton of side effects or risk getting kidnapped, stabbed on a sidewalk, or shot. I also recently discovered that one of the side effects is death due to cardiac arrest.

column2: Joann, 55-64 Female  (Caregiver)
column9: My 2yr old grandson has been on it for a week and his bowels are always loose.He is breathing better.He also has had a change in appetite.He's eating less and is hyper after taking his meds.He takes it easily and his cold is gone.His chest is clear and he doesn't snore as loud.I'm concerned about his appetite.We don't know for sure yet if he's got asthma.

column2: Joseph, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Albuterol is great!  The new propellant sucks!!!  I was prescribed Proventil.  Without some kind of counter, there's virtually no way to know how much you have left.  I've weighed full and empty canisters and found the difference in weight to be only 3/16 of an ounce.  I've kept a count sheet with the inhaler and marked down every puff I used.  It was empty, or at least no longer working after about 170 puffs...not the claimed 200.  I've given up on the new propellant and started buying Salbutamol (the name the REST of the world uses for this drug) from Mexico, because it still has the old propellant.For the first couple of years using albuterol, I followed the doctors advice, and took 2 puffs every 4 hours.  Didn't work for me.  Gave me anxiety attacks like you wouldn't believe.  When I complained about this to other doctors, they tried giving me meds to combat the anxiety, which had even worse side effects, and when my lung specialist finally told me that so much albuterol was causing the anxiety, I started taking it only when absolutely necessary.  I find that using it once or twice a day is almost as effective as using it 6 times a day.  I wish there was a medication that works as well without the side effects, and I wish the U.S. would go back to the old propellant.

I had a respiratory therapist tell me two weeks ago about mucamist, he said they use this on vent patients and it makes the mucus like water.

column2: Narek, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: At first my heart was pounding and I couldn't sleep.  I kept using it thinking I needed to get used to it.  After 2 months, I was using it day and night, instead of once before bed.  My lungs hurt, with congestion, and while in the shower, my lungs closed.  I grabbed an old bottle of Primatene Mist and it saved me!  Back on Primatene Mist, my condition improved drastically.  In 2 days, I was using only one spray at night and I coughed up a bunch of thick mucus and my lungs became clear without weezing again.

column2: MerryKat, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had severe muscle pain and heartburn with initial dose. Pretreated further doses with Tylenol and anti-acid tablet 30 min. before taking, had no further side-effects. Relieved soreness in lungs and reduced coughing and lasted for most of the day.

column2: james, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This has never worked for me along with other inhailers, even steroid inhailers, but I have found one that works and that is advair.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I use this about once a day before exercise and shopping.  I also use Advair once a day.  Albuterol works fast and well.No shortness of breath at all!

column2: christy,  Female
column9: I was prescribed albuterol for exercise-induced asthma, and this did not help my sports performance at all. It actually made it worse. One of the side effects were heart palpitations and anxiety, and before and during my games I felt nervous and so jittery that I couldn't concentrate. I did not feel my asthma symptoms improve either. I would not recommend using this before sports, or other activities that require a steady hand and focus

column2: barbara, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Albuterol inhaler gives me a splitting headache

column2: 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: Didn't know why I was very short of breath. Nurse used PFM, then administered Albuterol and repeated test. PFM had dropped from 220 to 160 and I was barely conscious. It swelled rather than dialated airways.

column2: canada, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Treatment with Albuterol inhalation aerosol relieved the symptoms of shortness of the breath and consistant cough

column9: I use this as my rescue med when I feel my asthma symptoms flaring. Most of the time it relieves symptoms and is very easy to use.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was wheezing and having trouble breathing. Doctor prescribed this drug for Bronchitis. It helped somewhat but I am still having trouble breathing and wheezing.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed albuterol for bronchitis.  I didn't notice any difference, but took it anyway.  However, I had to stop taking it at work because it made me REALLY woozy and out of it.  I was like a zombie all day.

column2: tasha, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I don't have asthma but I'm prone to getting bronchitis yearly around flu season. I'm usually prescribed this drug along side antibiotic and maybe a cough supp. and a steriod if needed. This tie i had serveral breathing treatments and steriod shot w/ the prescriptions. I really don't feel the difference when I use this. I think it is helping over the course of getting better but definalty isn't helpful to me for immediater relief - in fact I was told my a Dr once that it's not for immediate open lungs ...It's also very expensive. This version is better for the enviornment someone said - I would like to know more abou that... overall I'm glad I have it but I more hope it's working than feel it working - it's day 6 of a horrible case of "asthmaic bronchitis" and I'm almost better but still weazing and couphing and uncomfortably stuffed upI think I need that SPACER thing!!! I have been wondering why I felt so dizzy and shakey!! Thanks for mentioning that!

i use it 10 timess a day using 2 and 3 puffsand my body aches bad.

column2: phyllis.kea @usmc.mil, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: any time i have a shortness of breath albuterol works everytime.  Warrick is the best.. I have used others and they are not as good nor do they work as well........

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
column9: Both my son and myself use this drug for asthmatic symptoms...it is very effective.Many cpomplain of the jitters and racing heart,did anyone tell you that you should be using a spacer...EVEN FOR ADULTS AND ESPECIALLY FOR KIDS??? Unknowingly you could give your child a heart attack by administering these meds without a spacer...your heart may still race, but only a little...and the jitters...haven't really felt it like I did without the spacers...if your coverage won't cover it...they're only cheap...and will help with those 2 side effects. By the way...I got asthma during my pregnancy...never had it before.

column2: thenon, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Iam a post lung cancer and throat cancer patient and have used albuterol for the last 13 years I was given 6 mos to live in 1994 and I'm still here.. When I get short of breath I use this and it works fine and fast
